chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alease A Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alease A Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Alease A Johnson.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Court waived appearance. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State. Defense request a Plea/sentencing date. 
Defense advised to the plea documents 24 hours in advance of the hearing. 


Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Alease A Johnson in court with Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Alease A Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alease A Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alease A Johnson in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Alease A Johnson in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alease A Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1 and 2.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Adult Female Victim BLB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
